section.section: The term of each member appointed under subsection (a)(1), (2), (4), (5), (6), and (10) of this section is 3 years.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed.
A member may not be appointed for more than two consecutive full terms.

The terms of the members are as follows:
One-third of the members shall be appointed for terms of 3 years commencing October 1, 2000;
One-third of the members shall be appointed for terms of 2 years commencing October 1, 2000; and
One-third of the members shall be appointed for terms of 1 year commencing October 1, 2000.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed.

text.section: The Secretary may remove any member of the Committee for good cause.

A member of the Committee:
May not receive compensation for service on the Committee; but
Is entitled to reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.
The Committee shall be staffed by the Department.

section.section: An employee of the Developmental Disabilities Administration or the Mental Hygiene Administration may not be a member of the Committee or any subcommittee of the Committee.

The Director of the Office of Health Care Quality may not serve on a subcommittee of the Committee or vote on the disposition of an individual mortality review that was previously reviewed by the Office of Health Care Quality.

text.section: The Secretary shall select a chairperson from among the members of the Committee.
A quorum of the Committee shall be a majority of the appointed membership of the Committee.
The Committee shall meet not less than three times a year.
